Documentation for this format

name: VAFinishedOutpatientMedicationDispense
description: Dispensation of VA finished outpatient medication order

element.short: Dispensing a medication to a named patient
element.definition: Indicates that a medication product is to be or has been dispensed for a named person/patient.  This includes a description of the medication product (supply) provided and the instructions for administering the medication.  The medication dispense is the result of a pharmacy system responding to a medication order.
element.comment: The WG will be updating the MedicationDispense resource  to adjust each affected resource to align with the workflow pattern (see workflow.html).

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain any narrative
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource
whenHandedOver cannot be before whenPrepared
constraint.expression: whenHandedOver.empty() or whenPrepared.empty() or whenHandedOver >= whenPrepared
constraint.xpath: not(exists(f:whenHandedOver/@value)) or not(exists(f:whenPrepared/@value)) or ( f:whenHandedOver/@value >= f:whenPrepared/@value)

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
element.comment:
Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. 

This element is labelled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation.

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource  Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded in formation is added later.

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

element.definition: An Extension

element.label: REMARKS
element.definition: This field contains comments as deemed necessary by the pharmacy staff.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.label: LOGIN DATE
element.definition: This is the date the refill request was entered.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.label: DAW CODE
element.definition: Dispensed As Written code. This information is used for electronic claim transmission to third party payers (insurance companies).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.label: COPAY TRANSACTION TYPE
element.definition: This field contains the internal entry number of the pointer to the IB Action Type file (#350.1).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.label: METHOD OF PICKUP
element.definition: Enter any special instructions that should appear on mailing address portion of the label, specifing where, or when the RX(s) should be  picked up.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.label: RETURNED TO STOCK
element.definition: This field is used to indicate when and if the medication was returned to inventory due to the prescription not being picked up or mailed to the patient.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.label: WAS COUNSELING UNDERSTOOD
element.definition: This field indicates whether or not the patient understood the counseling on the prescription, if the patient was counseled.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.label: WAS THE PATIENT COUNSELED
element.definition: This field indicates whether or not the patient received counseling about the prescription.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.label: FILL DATE
element.definition: The date the prescription was filled.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.label: MAIL/WINDOW
element.definition: This field contains 'M' if the refill is to be mailed to the patient and 'W' if the refill is to be picked up at the pharmacy window.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.label: COPIES
element.definition: The number of copies made of the label for the prescription.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.label: PATIENT STATUS
element.definition: This field is used to show the status of the patient at the time the  medication was filled.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility - this is an identifier assigned outside FHIR.

element.short: Event that dispense is part of
element.definition: The procedure that the dispense is done because of.

element.short: preparation | in-progress | on-hold | completed | entered-in-error | stopped
element.definition: A code specifying the state of the set of dispense events.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.description: A coded concept specifying the state of the dispense event.

element.definition: Indicates type of medication dispense and where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered.

binding.description: A code describing where the dispensed medication is expected to be consumed or administered

element.definition: Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
element.comment: If only a code is specified, then it needs to be a code for a specific product. If more information is required, then the use of the medication resource is recommended.  For example if you require form or lot number, then you must reference the Medication resource. .

binding.description: A coded concept identifying which substance or product can be dispensed

element.definition: Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
element.comment: If only a code is specified, then it needs to be a code for a specific product. If more information is required, then the use of the medication resource is recommended.  For example if you require form or lot number, then you must reference the Medication resource. .

binding.description: A coded concept identifying which substance or product can be dispensed

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: Code defined by a terminology system
element.definition: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
element.comment: Codes may be defined very casually in enumerations, or code lists, up to very formal definitions such as SNOMED CT - see the HL7 v3 Core Principles for more information.  Ordering of codings is undefined and SHALL NOT be used to infer meaning. Generally, at most only one of the coding values will be labeled as UserSelected = true.
element.requirements: Allows for translations and alternate encodings within a code system.  Also supports communication of the same instance to systems requiring different encodings.

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.
element.comment: The URI may be an OID (urn:oid:...) or a UUID (urn:uuid:...).  OIDs and UUIDs SHALL be references to the HL7 OID registry. Otherwise, the URI should come from HL7's list of FHIR defined special URIs or it should de-reference to some definition that establish the system clearly and unambiguously.
element.requirements: Need to be unambiguous about the source of the definition of the symbol.

element.short: Version of the system - if relevant
element.definition: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured. and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.
element.comment: Where the terminology does not clearly define what string should be used to identify code system versions, the recommendation is to use the date (expressed in FHIR date format) on which that version was officially published as the version date.

element.label: DRUG
element.definition: The actual medication.
element.requirements: Need to refer to a particular code in the system.

element.definition: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.
element.requirements: Need to be able to carry a human-readable meaning of the code for readers that do not know  the system.

mapping.map: C*E.2 - but note this is not well followed

element.short: If this coding was chosen directly by the user
element.definition: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - i.e. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).
element.comment: Amongst a set of alternatives, a directly chosen code is the most appropriate starting point for new translations. There is some ambiguity about what exactly 'directly chosen' implies, and trading partner agreement may be needed to clarify the use of this element and its consequences more completely.
element.requirements: This has been identified as a clinical safety criterium - that this exact system/code pair was chosen explicitly, rather than inferred by the system based on some rules or language processing.

mapping.map: fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:mapsTo dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:hasMap fhir:Coding.userSelected.map. fhir:Coding.userSelected.map a fhir:Map;   fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected\#true a [     fhir:source "true";     fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale\#O   ]

element.label: TRADE NAME
element.short: Plain text representation of the concept
element.definition: Free Text that, if it exists, will replace the DRUG name on the RX label.
element.comment: Very often the text is the same as a displayName of one of the codings.
element.requirements: The codes from the terminologies do not always capture the correct meaning with all the nuances of the human using them, or sometimes there is no appropriate code at all. In these cases, the text is used to capture the full meaning of the source.

mapping.map: C*E.9. But note many systems use C*E.2 for this

element.definition: A link to a resource representing the person or the group to whom the medication will be given.
element.comment: SubstanceAdministration->subject->Patient.

element.definition: The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this event.

mapping.map: .inboundRelationship[typeCode=COMP].source[classCode=ENC, moodCode=EVN, code="type of encounter or episode"]

element.short: Information that supports the dispensing of the medication
element.definition: Additional information that supports the medication being dispensed.

mapping.map: .outboundRelationship[typeCode=PERT].target[A_SupportingClinicalStatement CMET minimal with many different choices of classCodes(ORG, ENC, PROC, SPLY, SBADM, OBS) and each of the act class codes draws from one or more of the following moodCodes (EVN, DEF, INT PRMS, RQO, PRP, APT, ARQ, GOL)]

element.definition: Indicates who or what performed the event.  It should be assumed that the performer is the dispenser of the medication.
element.comment: The performer will be reviewed as part of STU4.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
An Extension

element.label: DISPENSE DATE
element.definition: This field is used to show date/time the medication was placed into packaging.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.label: REMOTE PHARMACIST
element.definition: This is the name of the Pharmacist that remotely completed a refill for a prescription.
The organization the device or practitioner was acting on behalf of.

element.short: Medication order that authorizes the dispense
element.definition: Indicates the medication order that is being dispensed against.
element.comment: Maps to basedOn in Event logical model.

element.short: Trial fill, partial fill, emergency fill, etc.
element.definition: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. For example, Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

binding.description: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. For example, Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

element.label: QTY
element.definition:
TECHNICAL DESCR:  This field allows numeric entries only, both for CMOP prescriptions and non-CMOP prescriptions. It requires a number between .01 and 99999999, with a maximum of 2 fractional decimal places.
NOTE: QTY values that were on file prior to patch PSO*7*29 (released 2/17/00) may contain alpha characters.

mapping.map: RXD-4-Actual Dispense Amount / RXD-5.1-Actual Dispense Units.code / RXD-5.3-Actual Dispense Units.name of coding system

element.short: Amount of medication expressed as a timing amount
element.definition: The amount of medication expressed as a timing amount.

mapping.map: TQ1.6 Timing/Quantity Segment Service Duration.Prior to v2.5, ORC.7.3 Common Order Segment / Quantity/Timing / Duration component.  This is a formatted string, first character for the time unit (e.g., D=days), followed by the value.  For example, “D14” represents “14 days supply”From v2.5 on, TQ1.6 Timing/Quantity Segment / Service Duration.  This is a CQ data type (<Quantity (NM)> ^ <Units (CWE)>), thus for days supply, assuming the unit of measure is “days”, the numeric value is TQ1.6.1 (…|14^For backwards compatibility, ORC.7 was permitted through v2.6.  Both forms (field and segment) may be present in v2.5, v2.5.1, and v2.6

element.label: RELEASED DATE/TIME
element.short: When product was packaged and reviewed
element.definition: This field is used to show the date/time the medication was released for inventory purposes and copay billing if applicable.
The time the dispensed product was provided to the patient or their representative.
Identification of the facility/location where the medication was shipped to, as part of the dispense event.

mapping.map: RXD-13 Dispense-to Location; RXD-30 Dispense to Pharmacy; RXD-31 Dispense to Pharmacy Address

element.definition: Identifies the person who picked up the medication.  This will usually be a patient or their caregiver, but some cases exist where it can be a healthcare professional.
Extra information about the dispense that could not be conveyed in the other attributes.

element.short: How the medication is to be used by the patient or administered by the caregiver
element.definition: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.
element.comment: When the dose or rate is intended to change over the entire administration period (e.g. Tapering dose prescriptions), multiple instances of dosage instructions will need to be supplied to convey the different doses/rates.The pharmacist reviews the medication order prior to dispense and updates the dosageInstruction based on the actual product being dispensed.

element.short: Whether a substitution was performed on the dispense
element.definition: Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the dispense.  In some cases substitution will be expected but does not happen, in other cases substitution is not expected but does happen.  This block explains what substitution did or did not happen and why.  If nothing is specified, substitution was not done.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: Whether a substitution was or was not performed on the dispense
element.definition: True if the dispenser dispensed a different drug or product from what was prescribed.

element.short: Code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed
element.definition: A code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed.

binding.description: A coded concept describing whether a different medicinal product may be dispensed other than the product as specified exactly in the prescription

element.definition: Indicates the reason for the substitution of (or lack of substitution) from what was prescribed.

binding.description: A coded concept describing the reason that a different medication should (or should not) be substituted from what was prescribed

element.short: Who is responsible for the substitution
element.definition: The person or organization that has primary responsibility for the substitution.
Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical actions for a patient; e.g. Drug-drug interaction, duplicate therapy, dosage alert etc.

element.short: Whether the dispense was or was not performed
element.definition: True if the dispense was not performed for some reason.

element.short: Why a dispense was not performed
element.definition: Indicates the reason why a dispense was not performed.

element.short: A list of releveant lifecycle events
element.definition: A summary of the events of interest that have occurred, such as when the dispense was verified.
element.comment: This may not include provenances for all versions of the request – only those deemed “relevant” or important. This SHALL NOT include the Provenance associated with this current version of the resource. (If that provenance is deemed to be a “relevant” change, it will need to be added as part of a later update. Until then, it can be queried directly as the Provenance that points to this version using _revinclude All Provenances should have some historical version of this Request as their subject.).

element.label: REMARKS
element.definition: This field contains comments as deemed necessary by the pharmacy staff.

element.label: LOGIN DATE
element.definition: This is the date the refill request was entered.

element.label: DAW CODE
element.definition: Dispensed As Written code. This information is used for electronic claim transmission to third party payers (insurance companies).

element.label: COPAY TRANSACTION TYPE
element.definition: This field contains the internal entry number of the pointer to the IB Action Type file (#350.1).

element.label: METHOD OF PICKUP
element.definition: Enter any special instructions that should appear on mailing address portion of the label, specifing where, or when the RX(s) should be  picked up.

element.label: RETURNED TO STOCK
element.definition: This field is used to indicate when and if the medication was returned to inventory due to the prescription not being picked up or mailed to the patient.

element.label: WAS COUNSELING UNDERSTOOD
element.definition: This field indicates whether or not the patient understood the counseling on the prescription, if the patient was counseled.

element.label: WAS THE PATIENT COUNSELED
element.definition: This field indicates whether or not the patient received counseling about the prescription.

element.label: FILL DATE
element.definition: The date the prescription was filled.

element.label: MAIL/WINDOW
element.definition: This field contains 'M' if the refill is to be mailed to the patient and 'W' if the refill is to be picked up at the pharmacy window.

element.label: COPIES
element.definition: The number of copies made of the label for the prescription.

element.label: PATIENT STATUS
element.definition: This field is used to show the status of the patient at the time the  medication was filled.

element.label: DRUG
element.definition: The actual medication.

element.label: TRADE NAME
element.definition: Free Text that, if it exists, will replace the DRUG name on the RX label.

element.label: DISPENSE DATE
element.definition: This field is used to show date/time the medication was placed into packaging.

element.label: REMOTE PHARMACIST
element.definition: This is the name of the Pharmacist that remotely completed a refill for a prescription.

element.label: QTY
element.definition:
TECHNICAL DESCR:  This field allows numeric entries only, both for CMOP prescriptions and non-CMOP prescriptions. It requires a number between .01 and 99999999, with a maximum of 2 fractional decimal places.
NOTE: QTY values that were on file prior to patch PSO*7*29 (released 2/17/00) may contain alpha characters.

element.label: RELEASED DATE/TIME
element.definition: This field is used to show the date/time the medication was released for inventory purposes and copay billing if applicable.
